name: pixie
description: Pixie is an open source observability tool for Kubernetes applications. Using Pixie, developers can view the high-level state of their cluster (service maps, cluster resources, application traffic) and also drill-down into more detailed views (pod state, flame graphs, individual application requests). Pixie uses eBPF to automatically capture its telemetry data without the need for manual instrumentation.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
contribution_requirements_justification: https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md Asks users to refer to our style guide (https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/tree/main/styleguide)
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://docs.px.dev/
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Every change is committed into source control and periodically releases are cut and tagged.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_tags_justification: Tags are used for all releases. For example: https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/tree/release/vizier/v0.10.21.
release_notes_justification: Release notes are in annotated git tags. https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/releases.
release_notes_vulns_justification: There have been no publicly known vulnerabilities.
build_justification: We use a Bagel build system. See example BUILD file at https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/BUILD.bazel
test_justification: Tests are included and can be run with `bazel test`
test_invocation_justification: `bazel test //...` runs all tests in the project.
test_policy_justification:
https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
Requires that a test must be added for the bug/feature in question.
tests_documented_added_justification: Test are required part of changes, though exemptions are allowed under certain circumstances. Code coverage is tracked.
warnings_justification: Lint rules are defined in https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/.arclint and https://github.com/pixie-io/pixie/blob/main/.yamllint
warnings_strict_justification: We try to always address warnings. Any exceptions are noted with comments for why the exception is necessary.
crypto_password_storage_justification: We don't store usernames and passwords ourselves. We use OAuth with Auth0 or Ory's Hydra+Kratos for use management.
static_analysis_justification: cpplint, aslant, flake8, golangci-lint, golint, govet, jshint, shellcheck
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: We use `snyk` and `yarn audit` to look for common vulnerabilities.
static_analysis_often_justification: Run on every commit via Jenkins CI
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: We use the go race detector https://blog.golang.org/race-detector and ASAN/TSAN
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We use Jenkins CI to run tests on every PR and every commit to the main branch.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
implementation_languages: C++, Go, TypeScript, Starlark, JavaScript, Python, C, Shell, PHP, Ruby, Makefile, Dockerfile, Java, PLpgSQL, HCL

name: Corrfunc
description: ⚡️⚡️⚡️Blazing fast correlation functions on the CPU.
description_good_justification: Project description - "This repo contains a suite of codes to calculate correlation functions and other clustering statistics for simulated galaxies in a cosmological box (co-moving XYZ) and on observed galaxies with on-sky positions (RA, DEC, CZ). Read the documentation on corrfunc.rtfd.io."
interact_justification: Feedback is through GitHub issues. Not explicitly stated but implied as general practice within OSS
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/manodeep/Corrfunc/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: The repo is open-development - all source is available
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Changes.rst (version-controlled in the repo) contains all major/minor changes. Plus release notes on GitHub that accompany every release https://github.com/manodeep/Corrfunc/releases
release_notes_vulns_justification: Scientific software, does not really have a CVE
report_responses_justification: https://github.com/manodeep/Corrfunc/issues. The maintainers usually respond within hours, if not sooner
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Since this scientific research software, we do not expect to have vulnerabilities in the traditional sense. However, any perceived vulnerabilities can be reported as issues - https://github.com/manodeep/Corrfunc/issues
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We do not have any specific targets for vulnerabilities - however, issues are discussed on a much shorter timescale than 2 weeks
build_floss_tools_justification: Needs a compiler, the make command-line tool, `and the GSL library for building the command-line executables within Corrfunc. Building (and using) the python bindings additionally requires python and numpy. All of these are FLOSS
test_justification: Tested on GitHub actions and TRAVIS CI
test_most_justification: The entire API is tested on multiple platforms, with multiple software combinations
test_policy_justification: Any new functionality is tested against all combinations of user-specifiable options (through an inbuilt exhaustive testing framework for integration testing)
tests_are_added_justification: Major functionality changes are done through a pull request with code review and testing
warnings_justification: The code enables a broad range of compiler warning flags and treats warnings as errors within CI
warnings_fixed_justification: See above - code can not be merged that has warnings
warnings_strict_justification: See above. Warnings emitted by newer compilers also get fixed
know_secure_design_justification: Research software - security is not a concern
crypto_published_justification: Scientific research software - not really relevant
static_analysis_justification: Two code quality apps have been used (landscape.io and codacy) - we are looking for a new one at the moment
static_analysis_often_justification: The code quality checks run on each update to GitHub
dynamic_analysis_justification: Not deemed to be within the scope of the project
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We rely on the compiler to warn about buffer-overflows and the code-quality checkers
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.

description: Formal message specification and generation of verifiable binary parsers and message generators
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux/blob/main/LICENSE>.

floss_license_osi_justification: The AGPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Development is performed publicly on topic branches (named issue_#ISSUE) which are regularly merged into the `main` branch.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Release note can be found on GitHub: https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux/releases
report_process_justification: Issues can be submitted via GitHub: https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux/issues
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Vulnerabilities can be reported to recordflux@componolit.com as outlined in the security policy: https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux/security/policy
test_justification: Make targets (including test targets) are documented in docs/Development.md.
test_invocation_justification: Tests can be run directly using pytest (https://docs.pytest.org)
test_most_justification: 100% statement coverage is achieved. This is enforced in the CI and when running make test.
test_policy_justification: The policy is to create an issue on GitHub for every significant feature. Enough tests must be implemented to reach 100% statement coverage. All checkers / linters must pass successfully on new code. This is enforced in the CI.
tests_are_added_justification: The CI checks for 100% statement coverage. Issues and all resulting pull requests are reviewed by the core team before merging.
warnings_justification: We use flake8, pylint, mypy, isort, black and icontract-lint on the source code. SPARK code is proven using gnatprove.
warnings_fixed_justification: We have a zero-warning policy enforced by the CI and the Makefile. Suppressed legitimate warnings must be justified in a comment.
delivery_mitm_justification: Pythons package manage pip uses HTTPS by default. The GitHub website is HTTPS-protected.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: CodeQL is run in the CI.
static_analysis_often_justification: Analysis tools run in the CI on every git push and nightly.
dynamic_analysis_justification: Hypothesis (https://hypothesis.works) is used for property-based testing in the CI.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Python is used as an implementation language.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Tests are run with and without optimizations, the production tool is run without optimizations.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: GitHub actions are used on every check-in and pull-request can be merged only after a successful CI run (https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux/actions).
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers (https://github.com/Componolit/RecordFlux)
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: No reported vulnerabilities in the last 12 months.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Code is checked automatically in the Makefile and CI using black.
build_standard_variables_justification: The software is implemented in Python.
build_preserve_debug_justification: The software is implemented in Python.
build_non_recursive_justification: Pythons package manager pip is used for dependency resolution and building.
build_repeatable_justification: The software is implemented in Python.
installation_standard_variables_justific: pip defaults are used for installation.
installation_development_quick_justifica: All required dependencies can be installed from the source repository as documented in `docs/Development.md`.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: GitHub actions are run on every check-in and before merging a pull-request.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: 100% test coverage achieved and enforced by automatic checks using pytest.
two_person_review_justification: All code is review by at least one other person. This policy is enforced through GitHub's protected branches.
test_statement_coverage90_justification: 100% statement coverage enforced in the Makefile and the CI using pytest.
